description: Haunted by mounting unrest and rumors, Nikola Petrak decides to deliver the sealed archive—detailing historic disappearances and Council-sanctioned purges—to a trusted citizen committee, instructing them to verify and release the contents.

The archive is published at neighborhood assemblies, confirming accusations of disappearances by the BCI and triggering widespread shock. Vanished citizens, now re-emerging, share testimonies of secret detentions and system manipulation, fueling outrage.

Mass rallies gather in city squares as reemerged citizens and activist groups demand independent investigations and reparations. Media coverage and social channels amplify personal accounts, putting immense pressure on the Council.

Council factions meet in emergency sessions. The Directorate urges suppressing further disclosures, while Harmonists propose public concessions as public anger escalates. Work slowdowns and resignations grow among former system enforcers.

Under irresistible pressure, the Council concedes to an external review. Panels led by returned 'ghost users' begin publicly investigating BCI abuses, shifting power from the Council to citizen-led committees.
